Large data sets must be published before publication; all data "necessary to understand, assess, and extend the conclusions" must be made available after publication
column6: This policy is not mentioned or linked on the guidelines for authors page; location was not intuitive. Conflicting information about expected timeline of data availability as noted above.

column5: When work is posted as a preprint

Depends on the data type: "For certain data types (for example genomic data, nucleic acid or protein sequences), BMC mandates data deposition in a public access repository upon submission as there is a community-accepted standard of data deposition and data sharing." Source: https://www.biomedcentral.com/getpublished/editorial-policies#availability+of+data+and+materials
column6: The information about data publishing and requirements are spread out on a number of web sites. Some of the information is general for all BMC journals and some is probably specific for EcoDevo.

column5: Data is required to be deposited in publicly available repositories prior to peer review, or included as supplementary information files when the manuscript is submitted.
column6: The journal has what Springer calls type 4 research data policy: "Data sharing, evidence of data sharing and peer review of data required".  https://www.springernature.com/gp/authors/research-data-policy/research-data-policy-types
Same policy for all BES journals
also this wiley website https://authorservices.wiley.com/author-resources/Journal-Authors/open-access/data-sharing-citation/data-sharing-policy.html#standardtemplates which explains 'expects'

column5: it is a "condition for publication", but it could be (often is I think) after acceptance that they ask for it if not provided yet.

column5: A statment of data sharing plans is required for submission. All materials must be avaiable for editors and reviewers during peer review. All materials need to be stored in a community-approved public repositories prior to publication.
seems that journal is not active
column6: seems that the last issue was published in 2013

The wording initially makes it unclear if data must be provided during peer review or only after acceptance (i.e. "where all data underlying the study are available, or will be deposited" implies it can be done after submission and peer review). However, later on, it is clearly stated that data must be made available at submission for review.
Mandated at submission for editors/referees, encouraged after publication for readers.
